UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the HyipNexus application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

email.description: The email address of the user.

registrationDate.description: The date and time when the user registered.

referrerId.description: The UID of the user who referred this user.

lastProfitClaim.description: The timestamp of the last daily profit claim.

InvestmentPlan.title: InvestmentPlan
InvestmentPlan.description: Represents an investment plan offered in the HyipNexus application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the InvestmentPlan entity.

name.description: The name of the investment plan.

description.description: A detailed description of the investment plan.

minDeposit.description: The minimum amount required to invest in this plan.

maxDeposit.description: The maximum amount allowed to invest in this plan.

dailyReturn.description: The percentage of daily return offered by this plan.

duration.description: The duration of the investment plan in days.

isPopular.description: Whether the plan is marked as popular.

Investment.title: Investment
Investment.description: Represents a user's investment in a specific investment plan.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Investment entity.

userProfileId.description: Reference to the UserProfile who made this investment. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Investment)

investmentPlanId.description: Reference to the InvestmentPlan in which the user invested. (Relationship: InvestmentPlan 1:N Investment)

amount.description: The amount invested by the user.

startDate.description: The date when the investment started.

endDate.description: The date when the investment is expected to end.

status.description: The current status of the investment (e.g., active, completed, cancelled).

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a financial transaction related to a user's investment.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Transaction entity.

userProfileId.description: Reference to the UserProfile associated with this transaction. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Transaction)

username.description: The username of the user, denormalized for admin display.

investmentId.description: Reference to the Investment associated with this transaction. (Relationship: Investment 1:N Transaction)

type.description: The type of transaction (e.g., deposit, withdrawal, interest payment).

transactionDate.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred.

paymentGateway.description: The Payment Gateway used for transaction.

status.description: The status of the transaction (e.g., Completed, Pending, Failed).

transactionId.description: External transaction ID (TxID) for deposit verification.

withdrawAddress.description: Wallet address for a withdrawal request.

Referral.title: Referral
Referral.description: Represents a referral relationship between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Referral entity.

referrerId.description: Reference to the UserProfile who made the referral. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Referral (Self-Referential))

referredId.description: Reference to the UserProfile who was referred. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Referral (Self-Referential))

referralDate.description: The date when the referral was made.

bonusAmount.description: The bonus ammount awarded to the referrer.

Bounty.title: Bounty
Bounty.description: Represents a task a user can complete for a reward.

BountySubmission.title: BountySubmission
BountySubmission.description: Represents a user's submission for a bounty.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging. User profiles are stored in a top-level `users` collection where the document ID is the user's Auth UID. Investment plans and announcements are stored globally as they are public data. User-specific data like investments and referrals are nested under the user's document to enforce ownership-based security rules easily. Transactions are in a root collection to allow for efficient admin queries (e.g., list all pending deposits), while still being secured by rules that check the `userProfileId` field inside each document, ensuring users can only read/write their own transactions.
